description: From Middle French désengager ; dis- +‎ engage.

entries.meaning: (fencing) A circular movement of the blade that avoids the opponent's parry

verbs.description: disengage (third-person singular simple present disengages, present participle disengaging, simple past and past participle disengaged)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To release or loosen from something that binds, entangles, holds, or interlocks.
